articles.author: Steven Scheer, Maya Gebeily, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran said early on Wednesday that its missile attack on Israel was finished barring further provocation, while Israel and the U.S. promised to retaliate against Tehran's escalation as fears of a wider war intensified.
articles.title: Iran says it has finished attack on Israel amid fears of spreading conflict

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 21 people in Gaza on Tuesday, local medics said and fighting ramped up, as the Israeli military said it had been targeting command centres used by its Islamist militant foe Hamas.
articles.title: Israeli bombardment kills at least 21 in Gaza as fighting rages

articles.author: Steve Holland, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Democrat Tim Walz questioned Republican Donald Trump's fitness for office at the outset of Tuesday's vice presidential debate, arguing that the former president is too unstable to be trusted at a time of crisis in the Middle East.
articles.title: Walz, Vance clash on Middle East at start of US vice presidential debate

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.description: Claudia Sheinbaum was sworn in as Mexico's first woman president on Tuesday, taking the reins at a time the country is struggling with violence from organized crime and a hefty deficit in Latin America's No. 2 economy.
articles.title: Sheinbaum sworn in as Mexico's first woman president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's new Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Wednesday he wanted to strengthen his nation's alliance with the United States in his first call with President Joe Biden.
articles.title: Japan PM Ishiba expressed desire to strengthen US alliance in first call with Biden

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Fabian Hamacher, Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan shut down on Wednesday with offices, schools and financial markets closed ahead of the arrival of a weakening Typhoon Krathon, which is forecast to bring storm surges along the coast and torrential rain.
articles.title: Taiwan shuts down ahead of Typhoon Krathon's arrival, torrential rain forecast

articles.author: Andrew Hay, Daniel Trotta
articles.description: North Carolina will resume search and rescue operations on Tuesday, intent on delivering aid and making contact with hundreds of people cut off by washed-out roads and damaged cellphone towers in the wake of Helene.
articles.title: North Carolina searches for survivors cut off by Hurricane Helene

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia will run a nationwide test of its emergency public warning systems on Wednesday, letting sirens wail and interrupting television and radio broadcasts in a twice-yearly initiative amid the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia plans emergency public warning tests on Wednesday

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: NATO's new chief Mark Rutte voiced strong support for Ukraine on Tuesday and said he was not worried about the upcoming U.S. election as he could work with former President Donald Trump or Vice President Kamala Harris.
articles.title: New NATO boss Rutte pledges support for Ukraine, plays down Trump fears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine said on Tuesday it had launched an investigation into what it said was an apparent shooting dead by Russian troops of 16 Ukrainian prisoners of war, soldiers who had surrendered on the eastern front line.
articles.title: Ukraine investigating alleged shooting of 16 POWs by Russia
